{"step_by_step_thinking": "Meningiomas are tumors that originate from the meninges, the layers of tissue that surround the brain and spinal cord. Childhood leukemia survivors are at an increased risk for secondary malignancies due to the intensive treatments they receive, such as radiation therapy and chemotherapy. These treatments can cause damage to healthy cells and increase the risk of developing other types of cancer, including meningiomas.", "answer_choice": "A"}
